    Hiking

    Essential gear and tips for safe, enjoyable hikes across trails and terrains.

    üëü Footwear & Clothing

    • Sturdy hiking boots ‚Äì Support ankles and grip uneven terrain.
    • Breathable layers ‚Äì Stay comfortable in changing weather.
    • Waterproof jacket ‚Äì Essential for UK hikes and unpredictable climates.
    • Moisture-wicking socks ‚Äì Prevent blisters and keep feet dry.

    üéí Backpacks & Storage

    • Daypacks (20‚Äì30L) ‚Äì Perfect for short hikes.
    • Hydration packs ‚Äì Built-in water reservoirs for easy sipping.
    • Rain covers ‚Äì Protect gear during sudden showers.
    • Organiser pouches ‚Äì Keep essentials accessible.

    üß≠ Navigation & Safety

    • Map & compass ‚Äì Reliable even when batteries fail.
    • GPS devices ‚Äì Track routes and log progress.
    • Head torch ‚Äì Hands-free light for early starts or late finishes.
    • First aid kit ‚Äì Compact but comprehensive.

    ü•æ Trail Essentials

    • Trekking poles ‚Äì Reduce strain on knees and improve balance.
    • Reusable water bottles ‚Äì Stay hydrated without single-use plastics.
    • Snacks & energy bars ‚Äì Quick fuel for long climbs.
    • Multi-tool ‚Äì Handy for unexpected fixes.

    üõ†Ô∏è Nice-to-Have Extras

    • Binoculars ‚Äì Spot wildlife or enjoy scenic views.
    • Camera or action cam ‚Äì Capture memories on the trail.
    • Portable stove ‚Äì Brew tea or cook simple meals.
    • Sit pad ‚Äì Lightweight comfort for breaks.

    üí¨ Common Mistakes (We‚Äôve Made Them Too)
